data.title: Czech and Slovak comet discoverers
data.text:
Margita Kresáková (1927 - 2001), born Vozárová was a Slovakian astronomer. She discovered a comet 1954 f at Skalnate Pleso Observatory. She studied comets and meteors. Kresákova is an author and co-author of more than 60 scientific papers.

Margita Vozárová was born on May 21, 1927, in Èervená Skala, Slovakia. She studied astronomy at Comenius University in Bratislava and was graduated in 1952. Then she began to work at Skalnate Pleso Observatory. She joined other comet hunters there and became fifth Slovakian succesful comet hunter in 1954, when she discovered a new comet 1954 f. Here she met astronomer Lubor Kresák, whom she married later. When Lubor Kresák left Skalnate Pleso and moved to Bratislava, she followed him too. Both worked here at Astronomical Institute of Slovak Academy of Sciences.

Margita and Lubor Kresak´s got one daughter Katarina. They belong to a small group of astronomer couples, where both discovered an own comet. Besides Kresak´s only two husband-wife couple achieved this: A. Mrkos with ¼. Pajduáková and G. Shajn with P. Shajn.

Asteroid 4033 T-1 discovered by Cornelis J. van Houten a Ingrid van Houten-Groeneveld on Palomar plates taken by T. Gehrels on March 26, 1971 during Palomar survey was named to her honour (9821) Gitakresáková.
